sec [SEP] that bill , proposed by the sec last year , would require brokerage firms to disclose the financial positions of their holding companies , mandate large traders ' reporting of program or block trades , and improve clearing and settlement of trades between the futures and stock markets .

black & decker [SEP] black & decker corp. said it agreed to sell its bostik chemical adhesives unit to orkem s.a. , a french chemical company , for $ 345 million .
bostik [SEP] black & decker corp. said it agreed to sell its bostik chemical adhesives unit to orkem s.a. , a french chemical company , for $ 345 million .
bostik [SEP] bostik is the first emhart corp. unit to be sold as part of the power-tool manufacturer 's effort to reduce debt and consolidate operations after it acquired emhart earlier this year . black & decker said it plans to put other emhart units on the block in the future , with the goal of raising $ 1 billion in net proceeds . black & decker rescued emhart from the takeover bid of topper limited partnership last march by agreeing to acquire the maker of door locks and gardening tools for about $ 2.8 billion .

emhart [SEP] bostik is the first emhart corp. unit to be sold as part of the power-tool manufacturer 's effort to reduce debt and consolidate operations after it acquired emhart earlier this year . black & decker said it plans to put other emhart units on the block in the future , with the goal of raising $ 1 billion in net proceeds . black & decker rescued emhart from the takeover bid of topper limited partnership last march by agreeing to acquire the maker of door locks and gardening tools for about $ 2.8 billion .
topper limited partnership [SEP] bostik is the first emhart corp. unit to be sold as part of the power-tool manufacturer 's effort to reduce debt and consolidate operations after it acquired emhart earlier this year . black & decker said it plans to put other emhart units on the block in the future , with the goal of raising $ 1 billion in net proceeds . black & decker rescued emhart from the takeover bid of topper limited partnership last march by agreeing to acquire the maker of door locks and gardening tools for about $ 2.8 billion .
black & decker [SEP] the move significantly expanded black & decker 's product line , but also significantly increased its debt load .
black & decker [SEP] the acquisition boosted black & decker 's ratio of debt to total capital to more than 80 % .
black & decker [SEP] company officials have said they plan to reduce that ratio to less than 50 % over the next 2 1\/2 years . earlier this year , black & decker put three emhart businesses on the auction block : the information and electronics segment , the dynapert electrical assembly business and mallory capacitors .
emhart [SEP] company officials have said they plan to reduce that ratio to less than 50 % over the next 2 1\/2 years . earlier this year , black & decker put three emhart businesses on the auction block : the information and electronics segment , the dynapert electrical assembly business and mallory capacitors .

emhart [SEP] the three units contributed about a third of emhart 's total sales . in addition , black & decker had said it would sell two other undisclosed emhart operations if it received the right price .
bostic [SEP] bostic is one of the previously unnamed units , and the first of the five to be sold .
emhart [SEP] the five units generated sales of about $ 1.3 billion in 1988 , almost half of emhart 's $ 2.3 billion revenue .

angelo [SEP] when angelo hears that the young man claudio has made his fiancee pregnant before he could marry her , angelo summarily condemns claudio to death .
claudio [SEP] when angelo hears that the young man claudio has made his fiancee pregnant before he could marry her , angelo summarily condemns claudio to death .
claudio [SEP] when , however , claudio 's sister , isabella , a novitiate in a convent , goes to angelo to plead her brother 's case , the obdurate ruler immediately falls in love with her and , in a supreme act of hypocrisy , demands that isabella yield up her virtue to him in exchange for her brother 's life .
angelo [SEP] when , however , claudio 's sister , isabella , a novitiate in a convent , goes to angelo to plead her brother 's case , the obdurate ruler immediately falls in love with her and , in a supreme act of hypocrisy , demands that isabella yield up her virtue to him in exchange for her brother 's life .

duke [SEP] meanwhile , the duke , who set the original scheme in motion , appears on the scene disguised as a friar and becomes involved in a series of intrigues that has everyone fearing the worst possible outcome until the duke arranges a last minute reprieve for all concerned .

boyd [SEP] in the play 's major scenes mr. boyd demonstrates that he has a firm grasp of the shakespearean dynamic .
ellen lauren [SEP] when isabella -lrb- ellen lauren -rrb- confronts her brother claudio -lrb- matt loney -rrb- in his cell , explaining the price she has been asked to secure his freedom ; when isabella and the disguised duke -lrb- philip kerr -rrb- conspire to trick angelo ; and when mariana -lrb- annalee jefferies -rrb- , a woman wronged by angelo , confronts him with his past misdeeds , the performers bring the dramatic high points to life with intense energy and intelligence .

renaissance [SEP] for all of this year 's explosive run-up in stock prices , renaissance investment management inc. 's computer sat on the sidelines .
renaissance [SEP] renaissance , a cincinnati-based money manager , began buying stocks again this week with half of the $ 1.8 billion that it oversees for clients , according to people familiar with the firm 's revised strategy .
renaissance [SEP] it was the first time since january that renaissance has thought stocks are worth owning .
renaissance [SEP] renaissance declined to confirm the move , but its stock purchases were thought to have begun tuesday , timed to coincide with the maturity this week of treasury bills owned by the firm .
treasury [SEP] renaissance declined to confirm the move , but its stock purchases were thought to have begun tuesday , timed to coincide with the maturity this week of treasury bills owned by the firm .
treasury [SEP] the other half of its portfolio is expected to remain invested in treasury bills for the time being .
renaissance [SEP] wall street executives said they believed that renaissance 's $ 900 million buy program was carried out by painewebber inc .
painewebber inc [SEP] wall street executives said they believed that renaissance 's $ 900 million buy program was carried out by painewebber inc .
painewebber [SEP] as reported , painewebber bought shares tuesday as part of a customer strategy shift , although the broker 's client was said then to have been japanese .
painewebber [SEP] yesterday , painewebber declined comment .
renaissance [SEP] when it owns stocks , renaissance 's portfolio typically is composed of about 60 large-capitalization issues ; to make buy or sell moves , the firm solicits wall street brokerage houses a day or so in advance , looking for the best package price to carry out the trades .
renaissance [SEP] renaissance 's last portfolio shift , carried out by goldman , sachs & co. , was a highly publicized decision last january to sell its entire stock portfolio and buy treasury bills .
treasury [SEP] renaissance 's last portfolio shift , carried out by goldman , sachs & co. , was a highly publicized decision last january to sell its entire stock portfolio and buy treasury bills .
renaissance [SEP] the sell signal , which sent a bearish chill through the stock market , came when renaissance 's computer found that stocks were overpriced compared with bonds and treasury bills .
treasury [SEP] the sell signal , which sent a bearish chill through the stock market , came when renaissance 's computer found that stocks were overpriced compared with bonds and treasury bills .
renaissance [SEP] the dow average now stands more than 20 % higher , while renaissance 's portfolio of treasurys produced a return of about 6 % through the first three quarters of the year .
renaissance [SEP] the computer 's miscalculation has been painful for renaissance .
renaissance [SEP] almost any money manager holding stocks has turned in better results , while renaissance has played it safe with treasury bills .
treasury [SEP] almost any money manager holding stocks has turned in better results , while renaissance has played it safe with treasury bills .
renaissance [SEP] so why does renaissance 's computer like stocks with the dow at 2653.28 , where it closed yesterday , when it did n't with the dow at 2200 ?
renaissance [SEP] `` with the decline in stock prices and continued low or stable interest rates , stocks are representing a better value all the time , '' renaissance president frank w. terrizzi said yesterday .
frank w. terrizzi [SEP] `` with the decline in stock prices and continued low or stable interest rates , stocks are representing a better value all the time , '' renaissance president frank w. terrizzi said yesterday .
terrizzi [SEP] mr. terrizzi wo n't say specifically , explaining that if there was such a move , it would take about three days to complete the loose ends of the transaction .
renaissance [SEP] during that time , a buyer with the clout of a renaissance could end up driving up the price of stocks it was trying to buy if it tipped its hand .
terrizzi [SEP] but everything is relative to mr. terrizzi , so stocks in his view can become more attractive in comparison with bonds or t-bills , even if shares are more expensive than when they were sold in january .
renaissance [SEP] when the computer says switch , renaissance switches .
renaissance [SEP] competing asset-allocation firms march to their own computer models , so some have been partly or fully invested in stocks this year while renaissance has sat on the sidelines .
renaissance [SEP] as a result , competitors say renaissance has been looking for any opportunity to return to the stock market , rather than risk losing business by continuing to remain fully invested in treasury bills .
treasury [SEP] as a result , competitors say renaissance has been looking for any opportunity to return to the stock market , rather than risk losing business by continuing to remain fully invested in treasury bills .

holliston [SEP] assets of the 400 taxable funds tracked by ibc\/donoghue 's money fund report jumped to $ 351.2 billion in the week ended tuesday , the holliston , mass.-based newsletter said .
donoghue 's [SEP] the average seven-day compound yield , which assumes that dividends are reinvested and that current rates continue for a year , fell to 8.47 % , its lowest since late last year , from 8.55 % the week before , according to donoghue 's .
brenda malizia negus [SEP] `` lower yields are just reflecting lower short-term interest rates , '' said brenda malizia negus , editor of money fund report .

treasury [SEP] money funds invest in such things as short-term treasury securities , commercial paper and certificates of deposit , all of which have been posting lower interest rates since last spring .
treasury [SEP] the yield on six-month treasury bills sold at monday 's auction , for example , was just 7.77 % .

ge [SEP] the government 's startling allegations , filed only days before the scheduled start of a criminal overcharge trial against ge in philadelphia federal district court , challenge the motives and veracity of the nation 's third-largest defense contractor .
philadelphia [SEP] the government 's startling allegations , filed only days before the scheduled start of a criminal overcharge trial against ge in philadelphia federal district court , challenge the motives and veracity of the nation 's third-largest defense contractor .
ge [SEP] in a strongly worded response summarizing a filing made in the same court yesterday , ge asserted that `` prosecutors have misstated the testimony of witnesses , distorted documents and ignored important facts . ''
pentagon [SEP] the company attacked the government 's allegations as `` reckless and baseless mudslinging , '' and said its management `` promptly and accurately reported '' to the pentagon all relevant information about billing practices .
ge [SEP] the case strikes at the corporate image of ge , which provides the military with everything from jet engines and electronic warfare equipment to highly classified design work on the strategic defense initiative , and could cause a loss of future defense contracts if pentagon and justice department officials take a tough stance .

d.t . [SEP] instead of castling , a standard measure to safeguard the king , d.t . made a second-rate rook maneuver at move 13 ; then it put a knight offside on move 16 .
edmar mednis [SEP] `` only two classes of minds would think of this -- very weak human players , and computers , '' said edmar mednis , the expert commentator for the match , which was attended by hundreds of chess fans .
d.t . [SEP] by move 21 , d.t . had fallen into a deep positional trap .
kasparov [SEP] it allowed mr. kasparov to exchange his dark-squared bishop for one of d.t . 's knights .

kasparov [SEP] bishops usually are worth slightly more than knights , but in this case mr. kasparov was left with a very dangerous knight and d.t . 's surviving bishop was reduced to passivity .

blumenfeld [SEP] because the cd had an effective yield of 13.4 % when it was issued in 1984 , and interest rates in general had declined sharply since then , part of the price dr. blumenfeld paid was a premium -- an additional amount on top of the cd 's base value plus accrued interest that represented the cd 's increased market value .
blumenfeld [SEP] now the thrift that issued the cd is insolvent , and dr. blumenfeld has learned to his surprise that the premium is n't insured under federal deposit insurance .

salomon brothers [SEP] according to salomon brothers ' `` stub '' stock index of 20 companies whose debt is giant compared with shareholder equity , investors are already beginning to retreat from shares of debt-laden companies .
standard & poor [SEP] from january to early september , the index of stub stocks -- the tiny portion of equity that 's publicly traded following a recapitalization -- outperformed standard & poor 's 500-stock index by about 20 % .

national highway traffic safety administration [SEP] the national highway traffic safety administration said it will start enforcing stiffer regulations jan. 31 for so-called gray-market imports of vehicles .
congress [SEP] the regulations , required under legislation enacted by congress last year , will apply to imports of vehicles that were n't built to meet u.s. government auto safety standards and were intended for use in europe or elsewhere abroad .
europe [SEP] the regulations , required under legislation enacted by congress last year , will apply to imports of vehicles that were n't built to meet u.s. government auto safety standards and were intended for use in europe or elsewhere abroad .
nhtsa [SEP] according to the nhtsa , the new regulations will prohibit anyone other than an importer that has registered with the u.s. government , or a person who has a contract with a registered importer , from permanently importing a vehicle that does n't meet the u.s. auto safety standards .
congress [SEP] congress tightened auto safety standards for gray-market imports after u.s. auto dealers , including franchised foreign-car dealers , complained that they often were blamed when the second and third buyers of such vehicles found that the cars could n't meet u.s. auto safety standards .

skase [SEP] the sales are expected to raise more than 600 million australian dollars -lrb- us $ 462.2 million -rrb- , mr. skase said .

drexel [SEP] at a private dinner thursday , drexel burnham lambert inc. chief executive frederick joseph delivered a sobering message about the junk bond market to officials of prudential insurance co. of america .
frederick joseph [SEP] at a private dinner thursday , drexel burnham lambert inc. chief executive frederick joseph delivered a sobering message about the junk bond market to officials of prudential insurance co. of america .
prudential insurance co. of america [SEP] at a private dinner thursday , drexel burnham lambert inc. chief executive frederick joseph delivered a sobering message about the junk bond market to officials of prudential insurance co. of america .
joseph [SEP] mr. joseph conceded the junk market was in disarray , according to people familiar with the discussion .
drexel [SEP] he said drexel -- the leading underwriter of high-risk junk bonds -- could no longer afford to sell any junk offerings if they might later become troubled because drexel risked losing its highly lucrative junk franchise .
drexel [SEP] amid the market disorder , even drexel , which has the widest and most loyal following of junk bond investors , is pulling in its horns .
drexel [SEP] although the big investment bank still dominates the junk market , drexel has been unable to stem the fallout from growing junk bond defaults , withdrawn new offerings , redemptions by shareholders in junk bond mutual funds and an exodus of once-devoted investors .
mark bachmann [SEP] `` this is the worst shakeout ever in the junk market , and it could take years before it 's over , '' says mark bachmann , a senior vice president at standard & poor 's corp. , a credit rating company .
treasury [SEP] since the end of last year , junk bonds have been outperformed by all categories of investment-grade bonds , including ultra-safe treasury securities .
campeau [SEP] the fragile market received its biggest jolt last month from campeau corp. , which created its u.s. retailing empire with more than $ 3 billion in junk financing .
campeau [SEP] campeau developed a cash squeeze that caused it to be tardy on some interest payments and to put its prestigious bloomingdale 's department store chain up for sale .
bloomingdale 's [SEP] campeau developed a cash squeeze that caused it to be tardy on some interest payments and to put its prestigious bloomingdale 's department store chain up for sale .
joseph [SEP] in an interview , mr. joseph says his dinner discussion with the prudential executives acknowledged problems for junk .
prudential [SEP] in an interview , mr. joseph says his dinner discussion with the prudential executives acknowledged problems for junk .
new york stock exchange [SEP] unlike the new york stock exchange , where buyers and sellers are quickly matched , the junk market , where risky corporate loans are traded , is sometimes closed for repairs .
deltec [SEP] at closely held deltec securities corp. , junk bond money managers amy k. minella and hannah h. strasser say the problems of the junk market go deeper than a temporary malaise .
amy k. minella [SEP] at closely held deltec securities corp. , junk bond money managers amy k. minella and hannah h. strasser say the problems of the junk market go deeper than a temporary malaise .
hannah h. strasser [SEP] at closely held deltec securities corp. , junk bond money managers amy k. minella and hannah h. strasser say the problems of the junk market go deeper than a temporary malaise .
deltec [SEP] wall street securities firms , `` the primary source of liquidity for the high yield market , '' have been net sellers of junk bonds because of trading losses , deltec said in a recent , grim report to customers .
deltec [SEP] mutual funds have also been net sellers of junk bonds as junk 's relatively poor performance and negative press coverage have produced `` above-normal '' redemptions by shareholders , deltec said .
deltec [SEP] and , deltec said , buying has been severely reduced because savings and loans have been restricted in their junk purchases by recently passed congressional legislation .
deltec [SEP] `` in fact , savings and loans were sellers of high yield holdings throughout the quarter , '' deltec said .
minella [SEP] ms. minella and ms. strasser say they are managing their junk portfolios defensively , building cash and selectively upgrading the overall quality .
strasser [SEP] ms. minella and ms. strasser say they are managing their junk portfolios defensively , building cash and selectively upgrading the overall quality .
prudential [SEP] meanwhile , prudential , the nation 's largest insurer and the biggest investor in junk bonds , has seen the value of its junk bond portfolio drop to $ 6.5 billion from $ 7 billion since august because of falling junk prices .
james a. gregoire [SEP] `` we certainly do have a lack of liquidity here , and it 's something to be concerned about , '' says james a. gregoire , a managing director .
hogs [SEP] the junk market 's `` yield hogs are learning a real painful lesson , '' he says .
stuart reese [SEP] although the majority of junk bonds outstanding show no signs of default , the market has downgraded many junk issues as if they were in trouble , says stuart reese , manager of aetna life & casualty insurance co. 's $ 17 billion investment-grade public bond portfolio .
prudential [SEP] the big insurer , unlike prudential , owns only about $ 150 million of publicly sold junk bonds .
paul asquith [SEP] `` if anything , we 're going to see defaults increase because credit ratings have declined , '' says paul asquith , associate professor at the massachusetts institute of technology 's sloan school of management .
massachusetts institute of technology [SEP] `` if anything , we 're going to see defaults increase because credit ratings have declined , '' says paul asquith , associate professor at the massachusetts institute of technology 's sloan school of management .
sloan school of management [SEP] `` if anything , we 're going to see defaults increase because credit ratings have declined , '' says paul asquith , associate professor at the massachusetts institute of technology 's sloan school of management .
asquith [SEP] mr. asquith , whose study on junk bond defaults caused a furor on wall street when it was disclosed last april , says this year 's junk bond defaults already show a high correlation with his own findings .
asquith [SEP] one indication of a growing number of junk defaults , mr. asquith says , is that about half of the $ 3 billion of corporate bonds outstanding that have been lowered to a default rating by s & p this year are junk bonds sold during the market 's big issue years of 1984 through 1986 .
s & p [SEP] one indication of a growing number of junk defaults , mr. asquith says , is that about half of the $ 3 billion of corporate bonds outstanding that have been lowered to a default rating by s & p this year are junk bonds sold during the market 's big issue years of 1984 through 1986 .

new york stock exchange [SEP] program trading on the new york stock exchange in september rose to its highest recorded level as a percentage of total monthly trading volume .
new york stock exchange [SEP] september program trading amounted to 13.8 % of average daily new york stock exchange volume of 151.8 million shares , the largest percentage since the exchange began making such figures public in july 1988 .
big board [SEP] the big board says program trading describes a variety of strategies involving the purchase or sale of a basket of 15 or more stocks .
salomon [SEP] salomon brothers inc. was the top program trader in september , but most of the firm 's activity involved portfolio trading strategies other than stock-index arbitrage .
salomon [SEP] overall , salomon reported program trading volume of 75.2 million shares .
morgan stanley & co [SEP] the top stock-index arbitrage firm last month was morgan stanley & co .
morgan stanley [SEP] of morgan stanley 's 66.8 million shares in program trades for the month , 53.1 million were in stock-index arbitrage trades .

conner 's [SEP] analysts expect conner 's earnings to reach roughly $ 40 million , or $ 1 to $ 1.05 a share , on sales of $ 650 million , for 1989 , the company 's third full year in business .

compaq [SEP] but compaq had achieved that level of sales faster than any previous manufacturing start-up .
conner 's [SEP] conner 's performance is closely tied to the burgeoning demand for battery-operated computers , the computer industry 's fastest-growing segment .
conner [SEP] since its inception , conner has both benefited from and helped make possible the rapid spread of portable computers by selling storage devices that consume five to 10 times less electricity than drives used in desktop machines .
conner [SEP] today , conner controls an estimated 90 % of the hard-disk drive market for laptop computers .

irs [SEP] once such abuses become so pervasive , the irs builds another factor into its secret computer formula for selecting returns for audit and does n't need special projects for them .
irs [SEP] san franciscans have a much higher incidence of audits than average because more of them score high under that formula , not because irs agents envy their life styles .
congress [SEP] many openings for mass cheating , such as questionable tax shelters and home offices , have gaped so broadly that congress has passed stringent laws to close them .
irs [SEP] and laws requiring the reporting of more varieties of transactions have enabled the irs to rely on computers to ferret out discrepancies with returns and to generate form-letter inquiries to taxpayers .
social security [SEP] unreported alimony income can be spotted by computer because a payer of alimony -lrb- who gets a deduction -rrb- must report the former spouse 's social security number .

irs [SEP] but while irs computers focus routinely on target groups like these , the agency has assigned many agents to special projects that need more personal attention .
irs [SEP] in most cases , the irs says , these projects are local or regional , rather than national , and arise because auditors in an area detect some pattern of abuse among , say , factory workers claiming that having a multitude of dependents frees them from tax withholding or yacht owners deducting losses from sideline charter businesses .

new york [SEP] revenue-short states also are becoming more aggressive pursuers of tax delinquents , and perhaps none tracks them down with more relish than does new york since it acquired an $ 80 million computer system in 1985 .

lawson [SEP] mr. lawson also made it clear that he would be watching exchange rates carefully .

foreign relations committee [SEP] the public made up its mind about gen. noriega largely as a result of the hearings i chaired in the subcommittee on terrorism and narcotics of the foreign relations committee on feb. 8 , 9 , 10 and 11 , 1988 , and again on april 4 , 1988 .
noriega [SEP] it was during those hearings that the nation first learned the breadth and depth of gen. noriega 's criminality , and of his enduring relationships with a variety of u.s. government agencies .
noriega [SEP] those hearings also highlighted how gen. noriega was able to use his relationships with these agencies to delay u.s. action against him , and to exploit the administration 's obsession with overthrowing the sandinistas to protect his own drug-dealing .
noriega [SEP] as the report issued by the subcommittee concluded , `` our government did nothing regarding gen. noriega 's drug business and substantial criminal involvement because the first priority was the contra war .
noriega [SEP] unfortunately , this problem continued even after gen. noriega 's indictment .

roth [SEP] the roth plan would create a new , non-deductible ira from which money could be withdrawn tax-free not only for retirement , but also for the purchase of a first home , education expenses and medical expenses .
westmoreland [SEP] westmoreland coal co. , realizing benefits of a sustained effort to cut costs and boost productivity , reported sharply improved third-quarter results .
pemberton hutchinson [SEP] in an interview , pemberton hutchinson , president and chief executive , cited several reasons for the improvement : higher employee productivity and `` good natural conditions '' in the mines , as well as lower costs for materials , administrative overhead and debt interest .
westmoreland [SEP] for the past couple of years , westmoreland has undertaken an aggressive streamlining of all aspects of its business .
hutchinson [SEP] `` i think the ship is now righted , the bilges are pumped and we are on course , '' mr. hutchinson said of the restructuring program .
westmoreland [SEP] but he cautioned that westmoreland 's third quarter is typically better than the fourth , so investors `` should n't just multiply the third quarter by four '' and assume the same rate of improvement can be sustained .
hutchinson [SEP] nevertheless , mr. hutchinson predicted that 1989 would be `` solidly profitable '' for westmoreland and that 1990 would bring `` more of the same . ''
westmoreland [SEP] nevertheless , mr. hutchinson predicted that 1989 would be `` solidly profitable '' for westmoreland and that 1990 would bring `` more of the same . ''

westmoreland [SEP] westmoreland expects energy demand to grow annually in the 2.5 % range in the early 1990s .

china [SEP] china 's slide toward recession is beginning to look like a free fall .
china [SEP] in a report on china 's foundering economy , the official state statistical bureau disclosed that industrial output last month rose 0.9 % from a year earlier - the lowest growth rate in a decade for september .
state statistical bureau [SEP] in a report on china 's foundering economy , the official state statistical bureau disclosed that industrial output last month rose 0.9 % from a year earlier - the lowest growth rate in a decade for september .
beijing [SEP] `` the economy is crashing hard , '' says an asian economist in beijing .
state [SEP] a lengthy recession , if it materializes , would drain state coffers and create severe hardships for urban workers .
china [SEP] in china , however , there is n't likely to be any silver lining because the economy remains guided primarily by the state .
state [SEP] in china , however , there is n't likely to be any silver lining because the economy remains guided primarily by the state .
china [SEP] instead , china is likely to shell out ever-greater subsidies to its coddled state-run enterprises , which ate up $ 18 billion in bailouts last year . nor are any of these inefficient monoliths likely to be allowed to go bankrupt .
china [SEP] rather , the brunt of the slowdown will be felt in the fast-growing private and semi-private `` township '' enterprises , which have fallen into disfavor as china 's leaders re-emphasize an orthodox marxist preference for public ownership .
china [SEP] `` when the going gets rough , china penalizes the efficient and rewards the incompetent , '' says a western economist .
communist party [SEP] reports of an economy near recession come as officials prepare a major communist party plenum for sometime in the next few weeks .
china [SEP] some analysts believe china soon will begin relaxing economic controls , particularly by loosening credit .
people 's bank of china [SEP] one sign of a possible easing of credit policy was the decision this week of people 's bank of china , the central bank , to allocate $ 5.4 billion in short-term loans to pay farmers for the autumn harvest , the official china daily reported .

china [SEP] the cycle has been repeated several times since china began reforming its planned economy in 1979 .
china [SEP] and , because china 's leaders have abandoned plans to drastically reform the economy , it is likely to continue , analysts say .

bankamerica [SEP] bankamerica corp. reported a 34 % jump in third-quarter earnings , as its rocket-like recovery from nearly ruinous losses several years ago continued to be fueled by growth in consumer loans , higher interest margins and negligible loan losses .
bankamerica [SEP] for the quarter , bankamerica said it earned $ 254 million , or $ 1.16 a share , compared with $ 190 million , or 97 cents a share , a year earlier .
bankamerica [SEP] bankamerica spokesmen said preliminary reports indicate the company was n't materially affected by the tuesday earthquake .
bankamerica [SEP] for the first time in nearly two years , bankamerica results failed to improve in consecutive quarters , but the decline from the second quarter was attributable to special factors .
bankamerica [SEP] moreover , bankamerica continued to build its reserve against troubled foreign loans by boosting its loan-loss provision to $ 170 million , about the same as the previous quarter but well above the $ 100 million in the year-earlier quarter .
bankamerica [SEP] the provision rate was far above bankamerica 's actual net credit losses of $ 24 million in the third quarter , compared with $ 18 million in the second period and $ 38 million a year earlier .
bankamerica [SEP] as a result , bankamerica said its reserve against troubled foreign-country loans , once below 25 % , now amounts to 45 % of the $ 6.4 billion of non-trade debt it calculates it is owed by those nations .
bankamerica [SEP] by that key measure of operating efficiency , bankamerica turned in a better performance than its well-regarded los angeles-based competitor , security pacific corp. , which posted a 0.89 % return in the third quarter .
san francisco [SEP] but it continued to badly trail its san francisco neighbor , wells fargo & co. , which reported an extraordinary 1.25 % return on assets .

next [SEP] mr. jobs moved to remedy a couple of his computer 's drawbacks yesterday by lowering the entry-level price for a next machine by $ 1,500 , or 23 % , if the buyer chooses a hard-disk drive as an alternative to next 's optical-storage device .
next [SEP] the hard drive , which is the storage device of choice for virtually every desktop computer user , also now will supplement next 's futuristic optical device if buyers pay full price .
jobs [SEP] mr. jobs , co-founder of apple computer inc. , founded next four years ago in the hopes of fomenting a revolution in the way desktop computers are designed and used .
next [SEP] mr. jobs , co-founder of apple computer inc. , founded next four years ago in the hopes of fomenting a revolution in the way desktop computers are designed and used .
next [SEP] his next computer , introduced about a year ago and aimed primarily at university computer users , sports snazzy graphics , digital sound , built-in networking and a sleek black design .
next [SEP] universities can now buy a next computer without an optical storage device for $ 4,995 .
next [SEP] a computer with the optical device will still cost $ 6,495 , but from now on next will outfit every computer with a hard drive and supply one at no cost to those who have already bought next machines .
businessland [SEP] commercial customers can purchase the same system through businessland inc. , a computer retailer based in san jose , calif. , for roughly $ 3,000 more .
san jose [SEP] commercial customers can purchase the same system through businessland inc. , a computer retailer based in san jose , calif. , for roughly $ 3,000 more .
jobs [SEP] mr. jobs said the changes were prompted by requests from customers who are frustrated with the performance of the optical device , which is n't offered as standard equipment by any rivals .
jobs [SEP] another factor was that customers were asking , `` why do n't you give us a cheaper system ? '' mr. jobs said at a conference on university computing here .

watson [SEP] neither mr. taylor nor mr. watson have been charged with criminal wrongdoing .

statistics canada [SEP] canada , which is preparing to speed up tariff cuts with the u.s. , recorded a 47 % narrowing in its trade surplus with the u.s. in august , statistics canada , a federal agency , reported .
canada [SEP] u.s. exports to canada jumped 11.2 % in august from july while u.s. imports from canada rose only 2.7 % .
canada [SEP] as a result , canada 's trade surplus with the u.s. narrowed to c $ 656.5 million -lrb- us $ 558 million -rrb- in august from c $ 1.23 billion -lrb- us $ 1.04 billion -rrb- in july .
canada [SEP] the u.s. and canada , which do more trade than any other pair of nations , are to meet next month to arrange an acceleration of planned tariff cuts under the u.s.-canada free trade agreement .

left bank [SEP] whoever constitute the local left bank come out in force , dressed in black , along with a smattering of yuppies who want to be on the cutting edge .
glass [SEP] people in glass houses tend to look stoned .
glass [SEP] currently in the middle of a four-week , 20-city tour as a solo pianist , mr. glass has left behind his synthesizers , equipment and collaborators in favor of going it alone .
glass [SEP] the typical glass audience , which is more likely to be composed of music students than their teachers , certainly does .
philip glass [SEP] philip glass is the emperor , and his music the new clothes , of the avant-garde .
glass [SEP] softly introducing and explaining his pieces , mr. glass looks and sounds more like a shaggy poet describing his work than a classical pianist playing a recital .
glass [SEP] mr. glass has inverted the famous modernist dictum `` less is more . ''
glass [SEP] but the music has its charm , and mr. glass has constructed his solo program around a move from the simple to the relatively complex .
opening [SEP] `` opening '' -lrb- 1981 -rrb- , from glassworks , introduces the audience to the glass technique : never straying too far from the piano 's center , mr. glass works in the two octaves on either side of middle c , and his fingers seldom leave the keys .

commodity futures trading commission [SEP] the commodity futures trading commission plans to restrict dual trading on commodity exchanges , a move almost certain to infuriate exchange officials and traders .
cftc [SEP] the cftc said it will propose the restrictions after the release of a study that shows little economic benefit resulting from dual trading and cites `` problems '' associated with the practice .

house [SEP] the house 's bill would prohibit dual trading in markets with daily average volume of 7,000 contracts or more , comprising those considered too difficult to track without a sophisticated computer system .
senate [SEP] the senate bill would force the cftc to suspend dual trading if an exchange ca n't show that its oversight system can detect dual-trading abuses .

bsn [SEP] bsn corp. said it will begin an offer tomorrow to exchange up to one million of its common shares and all of its $ 16.6 million in 7 3\/4 % convertible debentures due 2001 for a package of new debt and common stock warrants .
bsn [SEP] each warrant allows the holder to buy one bsn share for $ 10.75 a share at any time over the next seven years .
bsn [SEP] bsn currently has 4.6 million common shares outstanding .
bsn [SEP] bsn also is offering $ 850 face amount of new notes and 64 common-stock warrants for each $ 1,000 face amount of its convertible debt outstanding .
bsn [SEP] bsn said it is making the offer to shrink its capital and increase shareholder value . if all the bondholders and holders of one million common shares accept the offer , bsn will increase its debt by $ 9 million , but it also will recognize a $ 2 million gain from retiring the old debt , said michael j. blumenfeld , president .

cnn [SEP] its watchers are , on the whole , a disloyal group of channel-zapping `` grazers '' and news junkies , who spend an average of just 26 minutes a day watching cnn , according to audience research .
cnn [SEP] the brief attention viewers give cnn could put it at a disadvantage as ratings data , and advertising , become more important to cable-tv channels .

centrust [SEP] it said the sale would give it positive tangible capital of $ 82 million , or about 1.2 % of assets , from a negative $ 33 million as of sept. 30 , thus bringing centrust close to regulatory standards .

chicago mercantile exchange [SEP] the first major event this morning in u.s. stock and futures trading may be a pause at the chicago mercantile exchange .
merc [SEP] under a reform arising from the 1987 crash , trading in the merc 's stock-index futures will break for 10 minutes if the contract opens and stays five points from friday 's close , a move equal to 40 points on the dow jones industrial average .
new york stock exchange [SEP] the aim of the interruption would be to ease the opening of the new york stock exchange , which would be hammered by such a volatile move on the merc .
merc [SEP] the aim of the interruption would be to ease the opening of the new york stock exchange , which would be hammered by such a volatile move on the merc .
big board [SEP] the big board also added computer capacity to handle huge surges in trading volume .
brady task force [SEP] most notably , several of the regulatory steps recommended by the brady task force , which analyzed the 1987 crash , would be revived -- especially because that group 's chairman is now the treasury secretary .
treasury [SEP] most notably , several of the regulatory steps recommended by the brady task force , which analyzed the 1987 crash , would be revived -- especially because that group 's chairman is now the treasury secretary .
brady [SEP] the most controversial of the brady recommendations involved establishing a single overarching regulator to handle crucial cross-market questions , such as setting consistent margin requirements for the stock and futures markets .
big board [SEP] big board and merc officials expressed satisfaction with the results of two limits imposed on of the merc 's standard & poor 's 500 contract , as well as `` hot-line '' communications among exchanges .
merc [SEP] big board and merc officials expressed satisfaction with the results of two limits imposed on of the merc 's standard & poor 's 500 contract , as well as `` hot-line '' communications among exchanges .
standard & poor [SEP] big board and merc officials expressed satisfaction with the results of two limits imposed on of the merc 's standard & poor 's 500 contract , as well as `` hot-line '' communications among exchanges .
s & p [SEP] during the first halt , after the s & p index had fallen 12 points , the big board 's `` sidecar '' computer program automatically was triggered .
big board [SEP] during the first halt , after the s & p index had fallen 12 points , the big board 's `` sidecar '' computer program automatically was triggered .
sidecar [SEP] during the first halt , after the s & p index had fallen 12 points , the big board 's `` sidecar '' computer program automatically was triggered .
merc [SEP] one merc broker compared the action in the s & p pit during the two freezes to a fire at a well-drilled school .
s & p [SEP] one merc broker compared the action in the s & p pit during the two freezes to a fire at a well-drilled school .
howard dubnow [SEP] `` you do n't want the fire but you know what to do , '' said howard dubnow , an independent floor broker and a merc governor .
merc [SEP] `` you do n't want the fire but you know what to do , '' said howard dubnow , an independent floor broker and a merc governor .
s & p [SEP] after reopening for about 15 minutes , the s & p index tumbled to its 30-point limit and the second freeze went into effect .
dubnow [SEP] traders then spent the last half-hour `` watching to see if the dow would drop 250 points , '' mr. dubnow added , referring to the level at which the stock market itself would have closed for an hour .
s & p [SEP] one observer estimated that 80 % to 90 % of the s & p traders `` were just standing around watching . ''

s & p [SEP] -- if s & p futures fall 12 points -lrb- equivalent to about 100 points on djia -rrb- , trading is frozen for half hour to that price or higher .

greece [SEP] for those hoping to see a modicum of political normalcy restored -- in view of greece 's eight-year misadventure under autocratic pseudosocialism and subsequent three-month hitch with a conservative-communist coalition government -- there is but one bright sign : the scandals still encircling former prime minister andreas papandreou and his fallen socialist government are like flies buzzing around a rotting carcass .

flies [SEP] for those hoping to see a modicum of political normalcy restored -- in view of greece 's eight-year misadventure under autocratic pseudosocialism and subsequent three-month hitch with a conservative-communist coalition government -- there is but one bright sign : the scandals still encircling former prime minister andreas papandreou and his fallen socialist government are like flies buzzing around a rotting carcass .

san francisco [SEP] a federal appeals court in san francisco ruled that shareholders ca n't hold corporate officials liable for false sales projections on new products if the news media concurrently revealed substantial information about the product 's flaws .
apple [SEP] the ruling stems from a 1984 suit filed by shareholders of apple computer inc. , claiming that company officials misled investors about the expected success of the lisa computer , introduced in 1983 .
lisa [SEP] the ruling stems from a 1984 suit filed by shareholders of apple computer inc. , claiming that company officials misled investors about the expected success of the lisa computer , introduced in 1983 .
apple [SEP] according to the suit , apple officials created public excitement by touting lisa as an office computer that would revolutionize the workplace and be extremely successful in its first year .
lisa [SEP] according to the suit , apple officials created public excitement by touting lisa as an office computer that would revolutionize the workplace and be extremely successful in its first year .
lisa [SEP] the plaintiffs also alleged that prior to the fanfare , the company circulated internal memos indicating problems with lisa .
apple [SEP] the suit claimed apple 's stock climbed to a high of $ 63.50 a share on the basis of the company 's optimistic forecasts .
lisa [SEP] but when the company revealed lisa 's poor sales late in 1983 , the stock plummeted to a low of $ 17.37 a share , according to the suit .
san francisco [SEP] in 1987 , the san francisco district court dismissed the case largely because newspaper reports had sufficiently counterbalanced the company 's statements by alerting consumers to lisa 's problems .
lisa [SEP] in 1987 , the san francisco district court dismissed the case largely because newspaper reports had sufficiently counterbalanced the company 's statements by alerting consumers to lisa 's problems .
lisa [SEP] however , it gave the shareholders the right to pursue a small portion of their claim that pertains to lisa 's disk drive , known as twiggy .
twiggy [SEP] however , it gave the shareholders the right to pursue a small portion of their claim that pertains to lisa 's disk drive , known as twiggy .
twiggy [SEP] the court ruled that the news media did n't reveal twiggy 's problems at the time .
apple [SEP] lawyers are worried about the ruling 's implication in other shareholder suits but pointed out that the court stressed that the ruling should be regarded as very specific to the apple case .
patrick grannon [SEP] `` the court was careful to say that the adverse information appeared in the very same articles and received the same attention as the company 's statements , '' said patrick grannon , a los angeles lawyer at the firm of greenfield & chimicles , which was n't involved in the case .
los angeles [SEP] `` the court was careful to say that the adverse information appeared in the very same articles and received the same attention as the company 's statements , '' said patrick grannon , a los angeles lawyer at the firm of greenfield & chimicles , which was n't involved in the case .

intel [SEP] intel 's stock rose in early over-the-counter trading friday , as investors appeared relieved that the company 's income from continuing operations was only slightly below the second quarter 's earnings of $ 99.3 million , or 53 cents a share , and that sales actually exceeded the $ 747.3 million for the second period .
intel [SEP] but intel later succumbed to the stock market 's plunge , closing at $ 31.75 , down $ 2.125 .
intel [SEP] in august , intel warned that third-quarter earnings might be `` flat to down '' from the previous period 's because of slowing sales growth of its 80386 microprocessor , start-up costs associated with a line of computers and costs of preparing for mass shipments of the company 's new 80486 chip in the current quarter .
